message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a great deal on this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm interested in the product, but $120 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $100 for it.
I understand that $100 is a bit lower than I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle. I'm now offering the product to you for $110.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but I'm still a bit hesitant to pay $110. I'm willing to pay $90 for the product.
I'm starting to think we're getting close, but I still need to make a profit. I'm willing to compromise a bit further, but I need to get at least $105 for the product. How about we meet at $105?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $105 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $95 for the product.

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we might not meet in the middle, but I'm willing to try one more time. I'll meet you at $100, but that's as low as I can go. It's a great deal, and I think you'll love the product.
I appreciate your willingness to try one more time, but $100 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $92 for the product.

I'm not willing to go any lower than $100, but I'm willing to throw in a small bonus to sweeten the deal. I'll include a free accessory that normally costs $10. If you're willing to meet me at $100, I'll throw in the accessory for free. That way, you'll be getting an even better deal than before.

I appreciate the offer of the free accessory, but I'm still not willing to pay $100. I'm willing to pay $90 for the product, and I'm not interested in the accessory if I have to pay full price for the product.
